intro: Centropogon yungasensis, commonly known as the Yungas centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Yungas region of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, mountainous environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
